title: Rebekah Vardy sparks Twitter row after branding doctors' receptionists "rude and stuck up"
text:
Rebekah Vardy sparks Twitter row after branding doctors' receptionists "rude and stuck up" The WAG didn't hold back when sharing her thoughts about doctors' receptionists on Twitter Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Footballer’s wife Rebekah Vardy has become embroiled in a social media row after criticising the attitude of some doctors’ surgery receptionists. 
The outspoken WAG, who is married to Leicester City player Jamie Vardy, posted a disgruntled tweet to her 32,000 followers about the way she felt she’d been treated during an encounter with a GP surgery. 
Rebekah, 34, said: “Why are receptionists at doctors surgeries so stuck up and rude! (sic)” 
While some users agreed with Rebekah, not everyone was impressed with the mum of four’s tweet; one fellow user was quick to reply: “I am a GP receptionist and am definitely not rude or stuck up, should we stereotype all footballers wives as well!!!” Rebekah Vardy posted her thoughts to Twitter (Photo: Rebekah Vardy/Instagram) 
Rebekah responded: “If you want to love! I’m speaking from my own personal experience and I’ve not come across a pleasant one yet!” 
Plenty of fellow users then chipped in to either agree or disagree with Rebekah’s post, sharing their own experiences of doctors’ receptionists. 
One told her: “I think that's a very unfair generalisation tbh.” 
Another countered: “I'm a doctors receptionist and am always polite and helpful to our patients. There are good and bad in every profession.” 
A third said: " I agree with Rebekah! Apparently receptionists can diagnose conditions too!" 
And a fourth added: "That is too true, some things are personal and you don't want to tell anybody let alone a receptionist." Read More
